name: run_command
description: Execute a shell command on the user's computer. Use this to run scripts, install packages, or perform system administration tasks. BE CAREFUL with destructive commands.

name: read_file
description: Read the contents of a file from the local file system.

path.description: The absolute path to the file.

name: write_file
description: Write content to a file. Can be used to create new files or overwrite existing ones.

path.description: The absolute path to the file.

name: move_file
description: Move or rename a file from a source path to a destination path.

source.description: The current absolute path of the file.

destination.description: The new absolute path for the file.

name: copy_file
description: Copy a file from a source path to a destination path.

source.description: The absolute path of the source file.

destination.description: The absolute path for the destination file.

name: delete_file
description: Delete a file from the local file system. USE WITH EXTREME CAUTION.

path.description: The absolute path of the file to delete.

name: make_directory
description: Create a new directory at the specified path.

path.description: The absolute path of the directory to create.

name: list_directory
description: List the files and subdirectories within a given directory.

path.description: The absolute path to the directory.

name: get_system_info
description: Retrieve information about the system (OS, memory, CPU, etc.).

name: open_app
description: Launch a desktop application by name.

app_name.description: The name of the application to open.

name: close_app
description: Close a running application by name.

app_name.description: The name of the application to close.

name: get_clipboard_content
description: Read the current content of the system clipboard.

name: set_clipboard_content
description: Set the content of the system clipboard.

content.description: The text to copy to the clipboard.

name: send_notification
description: Display a desktop notification.

name: remember_fact
description: Save a fact or user preference to long-term memory. Use this when the user shares something important you should remember (e.g., 'My name is Alice', 'I use Python', 'My API key is...').

importance.description: How critical is this? 7+ = Core identity (Always in context), 1-6 = Peripheral (Searchable).

description.description: Short context or description of what this memory is about.

name: search_memory
description: Search long-term memory for specific information. Use this BEFORE answering questions that might depend on past context.

name: list_memories
description: List all saved memories, optionally filtered by category.

name: create_skill
description: Create a new skill for the agent. This saves a markdown file in the skills directory that defines how the agent should handle a specific task in the future. Skill files should include triggers and specific command steps.

name.description: The name of the skill (e.g., 'Search Google', 'Analyze Logs').

description.description: A brief description of what the skill does.

instructions.description: The specific markdown content of the skill, including steps and examples.

filename.description: The filename to save as (e.g., 'search_google.md'). Must end in .md.

name: list_calendar_events
description: List upcoming events from Google Calendar.

timeMin.description: ISO format date string to start searching from (e.g. 2026-01-31T23:53:26Z). Defaults to now.

name: create_calendar_event
description: Create a new event in Google Calendar.

name: search_emails
description: Search for emails in Gmail. Returns a list of emails including 'id', 'subject', 'from', and 'snippet'. Use the 'id' to read a full email via 'read_email'. REQUIRES PRIOR USER CONFIRMATION.

name: read_email
description: Read the full content of a specific email by ID. REQUIRES PRIOR USER CONFIRMATION. You must ask the user before reading a specific email thread.

name: send_email
description: Send an email via Gmail. For standard chat, this REQUIRES PRIOR USER CONFIRMATION. However, for autonomous background tasks (Smart Tasks), you ARE authorized to send results directly to the user's configured email.

name: analyze_resume
description: Extract skills and experience from a resume file (PDF, DOCX, TXT). This helps me understand your professional background better.

path.description: Absolute path to the resume file.

name: draft_job_application
description: Draft a hyper-tailored cover letter and application strategy for a specific job description.

job_description.description: The full text of the job description.

name: draft_social_post
description: Draft a professional social media post (LinkedIn/Twitter) based on a topic.

topic.description: Topic or theme of the post.

name: create_reminder
description: Schedule a reminder or an 'Autonomous Action' (Smart Task). Use this for both simple alerts (e.g. 'buy milk') and complex future actions (e.g. 'search news every morning', 'email report in 1 hour'). If the reminder is an action I should perform myself, you MUST set autoExecute: true.

message.description: The reminder message. Use a fun, engaging, and slightly 'Chaos Brain' style tone to keep the user motivated!

dueAt.description: The ISO 8601 date string when the reminder should trigger (optional if 'repeat' is provided).

repeat.description: Recurring schedule (daily, weekly, monthly, or a standard cron expression like '0 9 * * 1-5').

autoExecute.description: If true, the agent will automatically execute a task when the reminder triggers.

taskPrompt.description: The specific task or prompt for the agent to execute if autoExecute is true (e.g., 'Get latest tech news and email them to me').

name: list_reminders
description: List all active and recently completed reminders.

name: update_reminder
description: Update an existing reminder.

dueAt.description: The ISO 8601 date string when the reminder should trigger (e.g. 2026-02-01T10:07:05.123Z).

name: delete_reminder
description: Delete a reminder.
